triples.name: Swarm robotics
triples.relevance: The paper surveys swarm robotics as the central concept, examining how multiple robots collectively solve problems.

triples.name: Robot
triples.relevance: Physical robotic agents are the fundamental tools used in swarm robotics systems discussed throughout the paper.

triples.name: Swarm behaviour
triples.relevance: The paper categorizes and analyzes swarm behaviors emerging from local interactions in collective robotic systems.

triples.name: Robot navigation
triples.relevance: Navigation is identified as one of the four main categories of swarm robot behaviors in the paper's taxonomy.

triples.name: Decision-making
triples.relevance: Decision-making is categorized as a core swarm behavior demonstrating distributed intelligence in robotic systems.

triples.name: Robotics
triples.relevance: Robotics is the foundational interdisciplinary field that encompasses the design, construction, and operation of robotic systems discussed in the paper.
